wsklimaR

Get the metadata of the stations given several meteorlogical element

The function getMetaStationbyElement() makes it possible to get the metadata of the met.no's stations that measure all the chosen meteorological elements.

getMetaStationbyElement(timeserietypeID, elements)

Arguments

timeserietypeID
0:Daily, 1:Monthly, 2:Hourly, 3:Normal Monthly, 4: Normal Daily, 5:Record Daily (not used)
elements
meteorlogical element as its code ("TAM", "RR", ...). Can be a vector of elements

Details

The output is a dataframe. This structure eases the conversion into json

Examples

tmp <- getMetaStationbyElement(timeserietypeID="2",elements="TA")
str(tmp)
#> 'data.frame':	947 obs. of  17 variables:
#>  $ amsl          : Factor w/ 421 levels "-1","0","1","10",..: 208 208 205 326 84 31 57 78 50 63 ...

tmp <- getMetaStationbyElement(timeserietypeID="0",elements=c("TAM","RR"))
str(tmp)
